column4: How can I use different mode/option/switches for Samba? How can I ensure it runs at start up?
it should already run at startup if you have the server installed
I don't have a printer, but that might be related to cups?
We can think about printers later, do you know how to change options?
what options do you want to change
Samba's options. It's -F by default, I want it -D.
I meant the opposite.
Default is -D, I want it -F.
ok which version are you on, as samba changed recently
10.10, to run Samba, the command is smbd. I found the options with man smbd.
yes, they removed the init script, it uses service now
kill any samba you currently have running
killall?
Operation not permitted, use sudo?
yes
so you've been starting samba manually?
No output, I guess it was succesfull.
Yes, through the Terminal.
right I have an idea what it might be thenn, as recently samba in ubuntu went from being an init script to an upstart one
do this, sudo service smbd start
Oops, no I didn't start it manually, but I can't get the printer on network without running the GUI.
The Ubuntu system shows up on Windows, but when I run GUI the printer appears.
you've lost me, what GUI? your desktop?
GUI of system-config-samba, and to make matters worse I'm gonna be sharing the printer with Windows XP, Vista AND 7!
